intro: Chusua kiraishiensis, commonly known as the Kiraishi's chusua, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Japan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flower clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to cool, temperate climates. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists. Its unique morphology and restricted range make it a subject of ongoing botanical study.
